stories.text:
I am currently working remotely and its been only 4-5 months in the job. I am going to start searching for a job in Japan or Germany to relocate there.

I am wondering what would be the best answer to 'Why do you want to leave your current job?' as this question will definitely come up in the interviews.

My obvious reason is to relocate to a first world country but that's not what I am going to tell them.

The product i am working on is a huge SPA but built in jQuery and vanilla JS. I feel like i am missing out on latest frontned stack and that will definitely hit my career in the future but not sure how i should phrase this as i don't want to appear as i took a bad decision joining my current company.

Any suggestions on how should i tackle this question when it comes?
stories.title: Ask HN: What to Tell the Recruiter/Interviewer?
Speed Up the IPFS DHT with Optimistic Providing
Show HN: Proposal for a new keyboard layout paradigm

stories.text: Hey HN. I am looking for experiences on how the Data Team is organised within your organisation. There are couple of insights from DBT[https://www.getdbt.com/data-teams/data-org-structure-examples/] and GitLab[https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/business-technology/data-team/]. There are many different functions like infra, application engineers, pipelines, analytics engineers, analysts, DWH engineers, data modellers and so on ... . How do they work together? How ownership model is defined especially in modern SaaS world with GC, Azure and AWS providing more and more out of the box "manage-free" solutions. How do you manage enterprise applications and their integrations into tools? Do you have team per domain, team per tool and/or team per function?
stories.title: Ask HN: How Data Team is structured within modern company org?
